title: TVLine Items: Mary-Louise Parker Visits Elsbeth, Hulu Orders Mindy Kaling Comedy and More
description: Mary-Louise Parker is getting caught up in a deadly throuple on Elsbeth. The Weeds vet will guest-star in an upcoming episode of CBS’ Good Wife spinoff as a decluttering guru who murders her husband to keep the third in their throuple all to herself, our sister site Variety reports. Additionally, David Alan Grier (St. Denis […]
author: Vlada Gelman
excerpt: 'Elsbeth' Season 2 casts 'Weeds' vet Mary-Louise Parker as a decluttering guru caught up in a deadly throuple -- get more details!
text: Mary-Louise Parker is getting caught up in a deadly throuple on Elsbeth. The Weeds vet will guest-star in an upcoming episode of CBS’ Good Wife spinoff as a decluttering guru who murders her husband to keep the third in their throuple all to herself, our sister site Variety reports. Additionally, David Alan Grier (St. Denis Medical) will appear in a separate installment as the owner of a family mortuary that caters to the one percent who does what needs to be done to hide the truth about a famous author’s botched funeral. Ready for some more recent newsy nuggets? Well… * Hulu has picked up the single-camera comedy Not Suitable For Work, created by Mindy Kaling (The Sex Lives of College Girls, The Mindy Project) and showrun by Charlie Grandy (Velma), our sister site Deadline reports. The series follows “five work-obsessed twenty-somethings striving for professional success and, if they have time, personal happiness in Manhattan’s most glamorous neighborhood, Murray Hill.” * The next installment of Ryan Murphy/Netflix’s Monster anthology series, which will chronicle suspected serial killer Ed Gein (played by Charlie Hunnam), has cast Suzanna Son (The Idol) in an undisclosed series-regular role, per Deadline. * The A24 film Queer, starring Daniel Craig, will be available to stream exclusively on Max, beginning Friday, March 28. * Chelsea Handler’s third Netflix special, Chelsea Handler: The Feeling, will premiere Tuesday, March 25; watch a trailer: * Iyanu, an animated series adapted from Roye Okupe’s graphic novel series Iyanu: Child of Wonder, will premiere on Cartoon Network Saturday, April 5, at 9:30 am ET, and stream the following day on Max. Watch a trailer: Which of today’s TVLine Items pique your interest?
html:
Mary-Louise Parker is getting caught up in a deadly throuple on Elsbeth.

The Weeds vet will guest-star in an upcoming episode of CBS’ Good Wife spinoff as a decluttering guru who murders her husband to keep the third in their throuple all to herself, our sister site Variety reports.

Additionally, David Alan Grier (St. Denis Medical) will appear in a separate installment as the owner of a family mortuary that caters to the one percent who does what needs to be done to hide the truth about a famous author’s botched funeral.

Ready for some more recent newsy nuggets? Well…

* Hulu has picked up the single-camera comedy Not Suitable For Work, created by Mindy Kaling (The Sex Lives of College Girls, The Mindy Project) and showrun by Charlie Grandy (Velma), our sister site Deadline reports. The series follows “five work-obsessed twenty-somethings striving for professional success and, if they have time, personal happiness in Manhattan’s most glamorous neighborhood, Murray Hill.”

* The next installment of Ryan Murphy/Netflix’s Monster anthology series, which will chronicle suspected serial killer Ed Gein (played by Charlie Hunnam), has cast Suzanna Son (The Idol) in an undisclosed series-regular role, per Deadline.

* The A24 film Queer, starring Daniel Craig, will be available to stream exclusively on Max, beginning Friday, March 28.

* Chelsea Handler’s third Netflix special, Chelsea Handler: The Feeling, will premiere Tuesday, March 25; watch a trailer:

* Iyanu, an animated series adapted from Roye Okupe’s graphic novel series Iyanu: Child of Wonder, will premiere on Cartoon Network Saturday, April 5, at 9:30 am ET, and stream the following day on Max. Watch a trailer:

Which of today’s TVLine Items pique your interest?
